Description: Fragment of shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vessel. Clay dull brownish, with creamy yellow slip on outside; hard fired. Paint glossy sepia to black, with additions in deep purplish red. At top, tongues (one overpainted red) above a line. In figured frieze below, neck of bird or part of an animal on right, black-figure, with added red blobs ringed by incisions, filling ornaments (rosettes) in outline technique.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes (1992, 204-5, N6): "Kardara's "Mixed Technique" style, School A of the Oxford oinochoe or related (RAng [= Rodiaki Aggeiographia] 207ff cf pl. 13y) For general style see also Walter- Karydi, Samos VI 1 no. 895 pl. 111; Alexandrescu, Histria IV 41 no. 54 pl. 5 with refs. Cited (listed under "North Ionian 2" ware) by Dupont [1983] 33; Akurgal Eski Izmir I pl. 115A."
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p.204, no N6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.881)
